alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 6:35PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Hot Springs and northwestern Fremont Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 635 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dubois, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Hot Springs and northwestern Fremont Counties, including the following locations... Dubois Municipal Airport and Double Cabin Campground. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Upper Wind River Basin; Wind River Mountains East; Wind River Mountains West
